main event: A Swedish pilot observed a shining metallic object in the sky near Hassleholm, Sweden on December 17, 1953.
interesting points: The pilot described the object as a silvery round or oblong celestial body that appeared and disappeared rapidly., The sighting lasted a total of nine seconds., The object was observed at a height of about 1,600 meters and was approximately 60 to 70 meters below the aircraft., Multiple witnesses, including the pilot's mechanic, corroborated the sighting., The object did not leave any trace of gas or condensation behind.
witness description: Pilot and mechanic, both from the Trans Air Sweden Company
